conversation.text:
Based on user preference cues, here are two movie recommendations:
1) "Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind" (2004) directed by Michel Gondry and starring Mark Ruffalo and Kirsten Dunst.
This movie is about a couple who get divorced but then decide to try to get back together. The title refers to the idea that even if two people were completely "spotless," they still might not be able to get back together, due to various reasons like personality differences, lack of interest in each other's lives, etc.
The movie is a comedy and is based on a short story by David Sedaris. The main characters are David and Lisa, who have been married for several years but then start arguing with each other more frequently than before. This causes Lisa to feel very depressed about her relationship with David and as a result decides to end their marriage by filing for divorce from David.
Lisa then spends the next few weeks trying to figure out how she can go about ending her marriage by filing for divorce from David, without causing David to feel extremely hurt and devastated about his relationship with Lisa.
rec_titles: Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind

Based on the user's constraints, I would recommend "Braveheart" as it is a historical drama that tells the story of William Wallace, an Scottish warrior who led his country against English rule during the Wars of Scottish Independence in the late 17th century.
The movie stars Gerard McSorley as William Wallace, David O'Hara as Johnnie Stewart, Jay O. Sanders as Archibald Douglas, and other actors.
Overall, "Braveheart" is a well-made historical drama that tells an interesting story of William Wallace and his fight against English rule during the Wars of Scottish Independence in the late 17th century.
